body:
🐲THE TARGARYEN TAG🐲

I was tagged by @chillyravenart

1. Your favourite/least favourite Targaryen: Rhaegar  /  Maegor

2. Underrated Targaryen: Queen Naerys (I feel like she’s underrated, at least)

3. Snog/Marry/Avoid Targaryens: Daemon/Rhaegar/Maegor

4. A Targaryen who deserved better: Rhaella, Naerys

5. OTP Targaryens: Jaehaerys x Alysanne, Aemon x Naerys, Rhaegar x Lyanna, Jon x Dany, Bloodraven x Shiera.

6. A Targaryen you’d like to go on holiday with: Egg, Maester Aemon or Rhaegar. I can’t decide.

7. A Targaryen you’d want to be best friends with: Daenerys

8. A Targaryen who just needs a hug: sad boy Rhaegar, Jon, Aegon III, Naerys, Rhaella…

9. Problematic Fave: Daemon. And Rhaegar, since people consider him problematic.

10. A Targaryen you’d go on a dragon ride with: The only dragon I want to ride is daddy Daemon

11. Favourite Targaryen bastard? Bloodraven and Shiera.

12. A Targaryen you’d want as a lover: Daemon. And Rhaegar. And Jon. And Aegon I… It’s hard to choose. But Daddy Daemon is top priority.

13. Which Targaryen dragon is your favourite? Vhagar & Viserion

14. Bloodraven: fan or ban? Fan

15. Viserys (son of Aerys II): evil twit or mentally scarred victim? A traumatized man that had bad genes. A bit of both, really.

16. Favourite non-Targaryen spouse/consort? Bheta!

17. Team Lilac Eyes or Team Indigo Eyes? Indigo because Rhaegar

18. Favourite quote by a Targaryen: “ Love is the bane of honor, the death of duty. What is honor compared to a woman’s love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms … or the memory of a brother’s smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.“ - Maester Aemon

19. Most badass Targaryen moment: The field of fire, of course.

20. Blackfyres: Yay or Nay?

A bit of both? It was a bunch of racist lords that wished Daemon to fight for the throne. If they had left him alone, the house could have remained loyal (at least for a generation).

21. Most touching Targaryen moment: Grandpa Aegon crying because of Rhaena.

22. Which Targaryen would give the best life advice? Jaehaerys The Old King.

23. Your favourite Aegon? Aegon the Conqueror

24. Which Targaryen was the most badass? THE CONQUEROR, THERE’S NO DOUBT.

25. Most heartbreaking Targaryen moment: The murder of Elia, Aegon and Rhaenys. Helaena having to choose between her sons.

tags: jon snow & william the conqueror parallels
summary: You know, I have seen people just equate Aegon the Conqueror with William the Conqueror and leave it at that.  But really...
body:
You know, I have seen people just equate Aegon the Conqueror with William the Conqueror and leave it at that.  But really besides “the Conqueror” there’s nothing that much in common with them.  The Targs changed some things, but culture wise not really (nobody was embracing incest as a proper practice…), but the Normans did.  Of course there’s similarities, but nothing personal.  Like looks, animal motifs, and values etc.  William the Conqueror actually has more in common with Jon Snow (whose real name is Aegon in the show).  There’s might be something about this on here, but I haven’t seen it.  So sorry if it’s been said before.  Also this isn’t directed at you.  I just like reading your blog and wanted to share my musings with you.  XD  I really couldn’t get it out of my head…

William was the Duke of Normandy.  Normandy meaning Northman Land.  Because it was created (as a gift from the French king) by Rollo and his group of Vikings who were also known as Northmen.  They married French women and with their children created the Normans.

Jon is of the Northmen only because of his mother and his uncle raising him.  There is no Northern association of any kind for the Targs.  The Targs don’t even look like what little has been recorded about the Normans.  William’s son Henry I was said to have had black hair.  The only thing I can really think of that is similar is the Normans were clean shaven and didn’t have beards.  But Vikings are famous for them and Normans were descended for them.

William the Conqueror was also called William the Bastard.  And it bothered him.  He could act rather impulsive when that got flung at him.

Jon was also bothered by his bastard status.  We all know about that.

Much is talked about how William the Conqueror conquered England, but he also had to fight for his own home, Normandy.  He became the duke at a young age due to his father (who ruled after his elder brother’s death) having died abroad.  Needless to say there were other people whose eyes were on Normandy.  3 of William’s guardians were killed and there is stories of how William had to be hidden.  A rebellion broke out and William had to flee and he took refuge with the French king, Henry I, his future uncle-in-law.  The French king then helped William reclaim his home.

Jon, of course, along with Sansa, had to fight for Winterfell.  They had help from the Wildlings and the Mormonts, but they would have lost without the Knights of the Vale.  And yeah, Danii is trying to reclaim the Iron Throne, but it’s not the same.  Unlike Danii, William was raised in Normandy and was made the duke.  The Norman nobles acknowledged the ducal authority and he was always supported and despite wars he was not overthrown with another replacing him as the Duke of Normandy (never officially).  Yeah, the Boltons did replace the Starks for a time, but they were never truly accepted by the Northmen.

William was described as being a fighter and a horseman without equal.  He was strong enough to draw bows that others were unable to and he had great stamina.

Well, everyone knows Jon’s ability as a fighter.  And of course being a great horseman makes one think of his mother, Lyanna.

And now I come to one of the reasons William the Conqueror is one of my fave historical figures.  He LOVED his wife Maud(or Matilda) of Flanders and she loved him (they were also cousins).  They had a successful and affectionate marriage with 9 or 10 children.  William was faithful to her and didn’t have any bastards.  There’s a legend (probably not true) that when William proposed marriage to her via a messenger (naturally it started as a political alliance) Maud was said to have refused by saying she was too highborn to marry a bastard.  Insulted, William rode over (the destination depends on the version and one is her own home) and threw her to the ground by her braids and then rode off.  Maud’s father, was of course outraged and for the insult he was going to war against William.  But before swords could be drawn Maud stopped it by refusing to marry anyone, but William.

Of course us Jonsas believe that Jon and Sansa will have a loving marriage that is also a political alliance.  A lot of us believe that when the North finds out Jon is a Targ they won’t be happy and will probably want Jon’s head.  And we believe the matter will be settled by Jon and Sansa’s marriage.  How that will go down is what we’re guessing at.  So bloodshed (mainly Jon’s) could be avoided by Sansa marrying Jon.

Henry I of France was not happy with William marrying his niece, his sister’s daughter. Maud was the daughter of the Count of Flanders one of the most powerful noblemen in France.  She was also descended from Charlemagne and Wessex royalty (that helped William in England).  Henry viewed that as a threat and then supported the barons against William, his nephew-in-law.  He invaded Normandy twice which failed both times.  It only ended with Henry I’s death.

A lot of us Jonsas believe Danii will not be happy with Jon’s true parentage.  She will see him as a threat and then move to eliminate him.  So the once allies, will then be enemies.  And it’ll probably end with Danii’s death.

Rollo, the one who founded Normandy, ruled with strict laws and hanged murderers and thieves making Normandy one of the safest places in Europe.  Also he was a Viking and they valued courage, truth, honor, fidelity, discipline, hospitality, industriousness, self-reliance, and perseverance and family was important to them.  And there’s all kinds of legends that are not true about them (i.e. the horned helmets).

It reminds me of the North and their code of justice and honor and their values.  The Stark children were sheltered and didn’t face all the danger and intrigue that happened constantly in the south.  Of course that changed thanks to Theon’s betrayal with the Ironborn and the Boltons, but they are unpopular.  Also the North, which was really seen with Robb, got all kinds of exaggerated legends about them like the Vikings did.

And mentioning Rollo…  His Scandinavian name was Hrolfr which literally means “fame and glory for the wolf”.  And William means “determined protector”.

The only Targ that has any connection to wolves is of course, Jon Snow.  And Jon is of course determined to protect the realm of men.  It was all in the Night Watch’s oath.  Also the Normans introduced chivalry (so I assume making oaths as well) to England.

That got longer than I thought. XD  Well, of course William the Conqueror and Jon Snow aren’t exactly alike (as no character in GoT is exactly like any one historical figure), but there are a lot of similarities, I believe.

Submitted by Rose

reblog.comment:
You know, I have seen people just equate Aegon the Conqueror with William the Conqueror and leave it at that.  But really besides “the Conqueror” there’s nothing that much in common with them.  The Targs changed some things, but culture wise not really (nobody was embracing incest as a proper practice…), but the Normans did.  Of course there’s similarities, but nothing personal.  Like looks, animal motifs, and values etc.  William the Conqueror actually has more in common with Jon Snow (whose real name is Aegon in the show).  There’s might be something about this on here, but I haven’t seen it.  So sorry if it’s been said before.  Also this isn’t directed at you.  I just like reading your blog and wanted to share my musings with you.  XD  I really couldn’t get it out of my head…

William was the Duke of Normandy.  Normandy meaning Northman Land.  Because it was created (as a gift from the French king) by Rollo and his group of Vikings who were also known as Northmen.  They married French women and with their children created the Normans.

Jon is of the Northmen only because of his mother and his uncle raising him.  There is no Northern association of any kind for the Targs.  The Targs don’t even look like what little has been recorded about the Normans.  William’s son Henry I was said to have had black hair.  The only thing I can really think of that is similar is the Normans were clean shaven and didn’t have beards.  But Vikings are famous for them and Normans were descended for them.

William the Conqueror was also called William the Bastard.  And it bothered him.  He could act rather impulsive when that got flung at him.

Jon was also bothered by his bastard status.  We all know about that.

Much is talked about how William the Conqueror conquered England, but he also had to fight for his own home, Normandy.  He became the duke at a young age due to his father (who ruled after his elder brother’s death) having died abroad.  Needless to say there were other people whose eyes were on Normandy.  3 of William’s guardians were killed and there is stories of how William had to be hidden.  A rebellion broke out and William had to flee and he took refuge with the French king, Henry I, his future uncle-in-law.  The French king then helped William reclaim his home.

Jon, of course, along with Sansa, had to fight for Winterfell.  They had help from the Wildlings and the Mormonts, but they would have lost without the Knights of the Vale.  And yeah, Danii is trying to reclaim the Iron Throne, but it’s not the same.  Unlike Danii, William was raised in Normandy and was made the duke.  The Norman nobles acknowledged the ducal authority and he was always supported and despite wars he was not overthrown with another replacing him as the Duke of Normandy (never officially).  Yeah, the Boltons did replace the Starks for a time, but they were never truly accepted by the Northmen.

William was described as being a fighter and a horseman without equal.  He was strong enough to draw bows that others were unable to and he had great stamina.

Well, everyone knows Jon’s ability as a fighter.  And of course being a great horseman makes one think of his mother, Lyanna.

And now I come to one of the reasons William the Conqueror is one of my fave historical figures.  He LOVED his wife Maud(or Matilda) of Flanders and she loved him (they were also cousins).  They had a successful and affectionate marriage with 9 or 10 children.  William was faithful to her and didn’t have any bastards.  There’s a legend (probably not true) that when William proposed marriage to her via a messenger (naturally it started as a political alliance) Maud was said to have refused by saying she was too highborn to marry a bastard.  Insulted, William rode over (the destination depends on the version and one is her own home) and threw her to the ground by her braids and then rode off.  Maud’s father, was of course outraged and for the insult he was going to war against William.  But before swords could be drawn Maud stopped it by refusing to marry anyone, but William.

Of course us Jonsas believe that Jon and Sansa will have a loving marriage that is also a political alliance.  A lot of us believe that when the North finds out Jon is a Targ they won’t be happy and will probably want Jon’s head.  And we believe the matter will be settled by Jon and Sansa’s marriage.  How that will go down is what we’re guessing at.  So bloodshed (mainly Jon’s) could be avoided by Sansa marrying Jon.

Henry I of France was not happy with William marrying his niece, his sister’s daughter. Maud was the daughter of the Count of Flanders one of the most powerful noblemen in France.  She was also descended from Charlemagne and Wessex royalty (that helped William in England).  Henry viewed that as a threat and then supported the barons against William, his nephew-in-law.  He invaded Normandy twice which failed both times.  It only ended with Henry I’s death.

A lot of us Jonsas believe Danii will not be happy with Jon’s true parentage.  She will see him as a threat and then move to eliminate him.  So the once allies, will then be enemies.  And it’ll probably end with Danii’s death.

Rollo, the one who founded Normandy, ruled with strict laws and hanged murderers and thieves making Normandy one of the safest places in Europe.  Also he was a Viking and they valued courage, truth, honor, fidelity, discipline, hospitality, industriousness, self-reliance, and perseverance and family was important to them.  And there’s all kinds of legends that are not true about them (i.e. the horned helmets).

It reminds me of the North and their code of justice and honor and their values.  The Stark children were sheltered and didn’t face all the danger and intrigue that happened constantly in the south.  Of course that changed thanks to Theon’s betrayal with the Ironborn and the Boltons, but they are unpopular.  Also the North, which was really seen with Robb, got all kinds of exaggerated legends about them like the Vikings did.

And mentioning Rollo…  His Scandinavian name was Hrolfr which literally means “fame and glory for the wolf”.  And William means “determined protector”.

The only Targ that has any connection to wolves is of course, Jon Snow.  And Jon is of course determined to protect the realm of men.  It was all in the Night Watch’s oath.  Also the Normans introduced chivalry (so I assume making oaths as well) to England.

That got longer than I thought. XD  Well, of course William the Conqueror and Jon Snow aren’t exactly alike (as no character in GoT is exactly like any one historical figure), but there are a lot of similarities, I believe.

Submitted by Rose

summary: Hi! Could I get a ship for Dolan Twins, Game of Thrones, Harry Potter, Marvel, Twilight, TVD/Originals, Pretty Little Liars, 13...
question: Hi! Could I get a ship for Dolan Twins, Game of Thrones, Harry Potter, Marvel, Twilight, TVD/Originals, Pretty Little Liars, 13 Reasons Why, Teen Wolf, and Divergent? If this is too long, you can choose which ones haha. I am 18, 5’3, with long dark brown hair and highlights. I have light tan skin, brown eyes, curvy, slightly chubby cheeks, and small/light freckles across my nose and my cheeks. I love playing piano, singing, and animals. I‘m adventurous, loyal, and I like to goof off a lot.
answer:
I’d ship you with Grayson Dolan.

Grayson is a goofy person who’d love someone to goof around with. He’d be taken with your adventurous nature and often use that to his advantage in every day life. Grayson would take you hiking, showing you his favorite sights and create a romantic atmosphere by doing it either at sunrise or sundown. He’d love hearing you play the piano, or just listening to you sing while he plays. He loves to pinch your cheeks, smiling lovingly whenever you slap his hands away.

I’d ship you with Jon Snow.

Despite his whole ‘I’m unworthy’ behavior, you’d always try and convince Jon he doesn’t need his last name to be Stark for you to love him. He’s funny and sweet, loyal and that’s why you couldn’t understand his need to go to the Wall and take the black all the while leaving you behind. He promised it was so you could find a proper husband, one that could give you a life worthy of a noble woman, but he was running and you knew it. Years have gone by where he’d still dream of you singing to him at the dead of night, wondering if he had lost his mind at times. Once he returns from the dead, you’re the first person he thought about, leaving the Wall to find you and make sure you’re alright. Finding you unmarried as you were still loyal to him despite his absence had both broken his heart and made it soar.

I’d ship you with Sirius Black.

You’d constantly be pranking one another in the craziest of ways, trying to be the better one in the pair. While other’s would refer to you two as trouble, you’d just smile and agree. Sirius was rarely ever serious, loving to just unwind and have fun with you and his friends and you didn’t mind him avoiding his family drama. Finding out he’s an animagus didn’t phase you, but made you happy as you got a two for one deal: boyfriend and a dog at once!

I’d ship you with Scott Lang.

Scott is an easy going person who tends to live his life on the dangerous side, but with you he’d never mess around. He makes sure you’re safe from any trouble before going ahead and rushing into a mission that could get him killed. Although it’s hard, you’d never trade that sweet man for anyone.

I’d ship you with Lorenzo St. John.

While you played the piano in a bar, you never expected a man with a guitar to join you. Playing in perfect harmony, finding a connection without even speaking, you and Enzo had began a relationship rarely anyone shared. Not only is he a romantic soul, but someone to rely on and someone who’ll always protect you whatever comes your way. With Enzo by your side, you’ll be laughing with those flirty lines he throws your way, finding that life has mysterious ways of bringing people together.

I’d ship you with Aria Montgomery.

Though you rarely interacted with Allison around, Aria and you have always shared a love for art. While she took photos and wrote, you were the musical prodigy that completed her. With A. on the loose, Aria had distanced herself from you, but you’ve been loyal to her from the start, making sure you stay in her life and no anonymous hater would ever push you away from her.

I’d ship you with Alex Standall.

After his suicide attempt, Alex had been in need of a way to release his pent up anger and guilt and music became that vent. He joined a support group where people wrote music or played music as they spoke about their struggles and that’s how you met. You became the goofy, always supportive person he missed in his life, one so loyal he didn’t have to worry about you leaving him for another. Though he still has trouble accepting his past, he found it easier to share it with you and it helped heal his mind.

I’d ship you with Lydia Martin.

She suffered a lot of loss in the past which made her weary about letting people in her life. Lydia was an ice queen with fiery red hair you desired to melt and bit by bit, you succeeded. She found it impossible to stay away once she realized the voices in her head were quiet when you were close to her and her nightmares stopped when you stayed the night.

I’d ship you with Caleb Prior.

Caleb had become a mess after the war, dealing with the loss of his sister who so unselfishly sacrificed her life for his own even after he betrayed her in the past. You weren’t the one to hate him for it or give him anymore guilt to deal with, but the one who offered her shoulder to cry on and a true friend for him to speak to when everything became too difficult. You were the only one to make him laugh at times like that and he became grateful to have you on his side. It took some time, but your friendship blossomed into a solid relationship, one he thought was impossible to find.

Years have gone by where he’d still dream of you singing to him at the dead of night, wondering if he had lost his mind at times. Once he returns from the dead, you’re the first person he thought about, leaving the Wall to find you and make sure you’re alright. Finding you unmarried as you were still loyal to him despite his absence had both broken his heart and made it soar.

I’d ship you with Sirius Black.

You’d constantly be pranking one another in the craziest of ways, trying to be the better one in the pair. While other’s would refer to you two as trouble, you’d just smile and agree. Sirius was rarely ever serious, loving to just unwind and have fun with you and his friends and you didn’t mind him avoiding his family drama. Finding out he’s an animagus didn’t phase you, but made you happy as you got a two for one deal: boyfriend and a dog at once!

I’d ship you with Scott Lang.

Scott is an easy going person who tends to live his life on the dangerous side, but with you he’d never mess around. He makes sure you’re safe from any trouble before going ahead and rushing into a mission that could get him killed. Although it’s hard, you’d never trade that sweet man for anyone.

I’d ship you with Lorenzo St. John.

While you played the piano in a bar, you never expected a man with a guitar to join you. Playing in perfect harmony, finding a connection without even speaking, you and Enzo had began a relationship rarely anyone shared. Not only is he a romantic soul, but someone to rely on and someone who’ll always protect you whatever comes your way. With Enzo by your side, you’ll be laughing with those flirty lines he throws your way, finding that life has mysterious ways of bringing people together.

I’d ship you with Aria Montgomery.

Though you rarely interacted with Allison around, Aria and you have always shared a love for art. While she took photos and wrote, you were the musical prodigy that completed her. With A. on the loose, Aria had distanced herself from you, but you’ve been loyal to her from the start, making sure you stay in her life and no anonymous hater would ever push you away from her.

I’d ship you with Alex Standall.

After his suicide attempt, Alex had been in need of a way to release his pent up anger and guilt and music became that vent. He joined a support group where people wrote music or played music as they spoke about their struggles and that’s how you met. You became the goofy, always supportive person he missed in his life, one so loyal he didn’t have to worry about you leaving him for another. Though he still has trouble accepting his past, he found it easier to share it with you and it helped heal his mind.

I’d ship you with Lydia Martin.

She suffered a lot of loss in the past which made her weary about letting people in her life. Lydia was an ice queen with fiery red hair you desired to melt and bit by bit, you succeeded. She found it impossible to stay away once she realized the voices in her head were quiet when you were close to her and her nightmares stopped when you stayed the night.

I’d ship you with Caleb Prior.

Caleb had become a mess after the war, dealing with the loss of his sister who so unselfishly sacrificed her life for his own even after he betrayed her in the past. You weren’t the one to hate him for it or give him anymore guilt to deal with, but the one who offered her shoulder to cry on and a true friend for him to speak to when everything became too difficult. You were the only one to make him laugh at times like that and he became grateful to have you on his side. It took some time, but your friendship blossomed into a solid relationship, one he thought was impossible to find.

tags: schrodinger's cat's got nothin' on ashara dayne
summary: Hi, pardon me if you've ever been asked something like this, but (in your opinion) if Ashara had lived, would people still see...
question: Hi, pardon me if you've ever been asked something like this, but (in your opinion) if Ashara had lived, would people still see her as being Jon Snow's mother? And if they did, do you think she herself would say otherwise? I know we know next to nothing about her, but I do believe it highly likely she is the reason Ned found the tower.
answer:
There are theories that Ashara faked her death, and while I’m not a big fan of any (mostly regarding the mysterious ladies she’s theorized to be disguised as), it’s still an open possibility, so we should really amend this question to “if Ashara had lived / was publicly known to be alive.” Anyway, would people still think she could be Jon Snow’s mother? Well… someone being alive has never stopped rumors about them before, and Ned and Ashara’s dance at Harrenhal was seen by many, so yeah, I’d think she’d come up a lot. It would just change the tone of the rumors, away from the “Ned raising their child after her tragic suicide” aspect to more of a “tragically stolen baby” aspect. (Much like Cersei insinuates as the reason for Ashara’s suicide.)

Would Ashara say otherwise? It greatly depends on what kind of cover story she and Ned would come up with for Jon’s existence. Like, the Dayne wetnurse Wylla was apparently part of the actual cover story, which according to some theories Ashara suggested. (Before her death or faked death, depending.) If Ashara lived, the Wylla cover story could still be a thing. But possibly Ashara would prefer to take the issue on herself, like Ned took the accountability for Jon upon himself (and didn’t try to say he was Brandon’s even if there weren’t timeline issues). It would really depend on

  • what kind of relationship Ashara and Lyanna had (like, if Ashara did tell Ned about the Tower of Joy, had she been there at all? or did she only find out through Arthur? Who even decided on the Tower in the first place? When did Wylla start taking care of Jon, at the Tower or at Starfall? If Wylla was at the Tower and was Lyanna’s midwife, was it Arthur who brought her there or was Ashara involved in that too? How much does all of this relate to the unknown father of Ashara’s own child? Not to mention, how does this relate to Ashara being Elia’s lady-in-waiting, and Elia’s knowledge of the whole R/L thing, and Ashara’s relationship to Rhaegar via Elia and/or Arthur? it is a mystery)
  • what kind of marriage prospects Ashara had or wanted to have (again, the whole mysterious pregnancy thing; assuming it was Brandon’s and was a stillbirth as Barristan believes, would Ashara have even wanted to marry some rando afterwards? maybe she would prefer to stay single and would be happy to use the scandalous rumors about Jon as an excuse? we just don’t know)
  • what kind of person Ashara was (since GRRM has told us very little except “beautiful” and “laughing purple eyes”/“haunting violet eyes” sigh)

So, unfortunately a true answer to your question really depends on resolving the whole mystery about R+L=J, who knew what when, and why and where, even. And the whole Ashara’s child mystery, and the mystery of her suicide (or faked suicide), and everything. And of course, we would have to know anything concrete and real about her personality, which we really don’t. So, sorry for the ambiguity, but it’s a remarkably ambiguous subject…
